title: MLB Boxscores(datetime.today()) does not return list of todays games
body:
**Describe the bug**
Using the mlb api, running 'Boxscores(datetime.today()) does not return todays games. Rather, it returns a dictionary, and in it there are only yesterdays games. This is presumably because today's games have not yet been updated with the results, however if you try to run 'Boxscores(tomorrow, tomorrow + 7 days), you just get a dictionary with the next 7 days as keys, but in every entry you get the same list of yesterdays games. This should return at least the index of the future games. 

**To Reproduce**
Sample code which causes an issue.
```python
from datetime import datetime
from sportsreference.mlb.boxscore import Boxscore, Boxscores

games = Boxscores(datetime(2020, 9, 1), datetime(2020, 9, 8))
print(games.games)
```

**Expected behavior**
I would expect the above code to return a dictionary with each future date as keys (which it does), and in each of these entries, have a list of the game data for the future (which is does not).
